titles.ar: بَابُ مَنْ قَالَ أَسْتَغْفِرُ اللَّهَ الَّذِي لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا هُوَ الْحَيُّ الْقَيُّومُ ذُو الْجَلَالِ وَ الْإِكْرَامِ وَ أَتُوبُ إِلَيْهِ
titles.en: Chapter 47 – The one who says, ‘I seek Forgiveness of Allah<sup>azwj</sup>, Who, there is no God except Him<sup>azwj</sup>, the Living, with Majesty and the Benevolence, and I repent to Him<sup>azwj</sup>

titles.ar: بَابُ مَنْ قَالَ أَسْتَغْفِرُ اللَّهَ الَّذِي لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا هُوَ الْحَيُّ الْقَيُّومُ ذُو الْجَلَالِ وَ الْإِكْرَامِ وَ أَتُوبُ إِلَيْهِ
titles.en: Chapter 47 – The one who says, ‘I seek Forgiveness of Allah<sup>azwj</sup>, Who, there is no God except Him<sup>azwj</sup>, the Living, with Majesty and the Benevolence, and I repent to Him<sup>azwj</sup>

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (2/215)
text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ عَبْدِ الصَّمَدِ عَنِ الْحُسَيْنِ بْنِ حَمَّادٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ مَنْ قَالَ فِي دُبُرِ صَلَاةِ الْفَرِيضَةِ قَبْلَ أَنْ يَثْنِيَ رِجْلَيْهِ أَسْتَغْفِرُ.
اللَّهَ الَّذِي لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا هُوَ الْحَيُّ الْقَيُّومُ ذُو الْجَلَالِ وَ الْإِكْرَامِ وَ أَتُوبُ إِلَيْهِ ثَلَاثَ مَرَّاتٍ
غَفَرَ اللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ لَهُ ذُنُوبَهُ وَ لَوْ كَانَتْ مِثْلَ زَبَدِ الْبَحْرِ

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Isa,, from Abdul Samad, from Al Husayn Bin Hammad,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Ja’farasws having said: ‘The one who says at the end of the Obligatory Salāt, before he bends his legs,
‘Allahazwj is Who, there is no God except Himazwj. Heazwj is the Living, the Everlasting, with Majesty and the Benevolence, and I repent to Himazwj’, three times.
Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic would Forgive his sins for him, and even if they were the likes of the foam of the sea (numerous)’.
en.sarwar: 1. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn ‘Isa from ‘Abd al-Samad from al-Husayn ibn Hammad from abu Ja’far (a.s.) who has said the following: “Whoever after an obligatory prayer and before moving his legs to a second position says, ‘I plead before Allah for forgiveness, no one deserves to be worshipped except Allah, the Living, the Guardian, the Possessor of Glory and Honor and to Him I return,’ three times Allah, the Most Majestic, the Most Holy, will forgive his sins even if they are as much as the bubbles of the ocean.’”
